text: Grab a line's whitespace/indention with Python
Basically, if I have a line of text which starts with indention, what's the best way to grab that indention and put it into a variable in Python?
For example, if the line is:

code: \t\tthis line has two tabs of indention
this line has four spaces of indention

text: Then it would return four spaces.
So I guess you could say that I just need to strip everything from a string from first non-whitespace character to the end.
